result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James H. Kirsch

defendant.name: Kirsch, James H.
defendant.address: 6730 E. Lake Terrace Estates, Three Lakes, WI 54562

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 4:02 p.m. Defendant James H. Kirsch in court with attorney Robert Elwood Hanson. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court statement--competency evaluation completed/Kirsch not competent to stand trial. Court speaks to s. 971.14(6)(a) discharged/release; s. 971.14(6)(b) referral for Chapter 51 not appropriate. Court orders Kirsch discharged/released Kirsch. Court notes page 5 from report; s. 343.16(5)(b)/Sect. 112 of Administrative Code.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: 4:22 p.m. Court Commissioner John Hogan. Attorney Robert Elwood Hanson in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not appear. Michlig requests adjourned date due to non-appearance of Defendant and Judge Bloom's absence. Attorney Hansen to provide defendant notice with copy to Court. Adj. 4:24 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: 4:05 p.m. Defendant James H. Kirsch in court with attorney Robert Elwood Hanson.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of evaluation. Michlig statement to evaluator's opinion as to competency. Hanson states in agreement with State. Pursuant to 971.14(4)(b) - Court questions defendant regarding competency. Michlig/Hansen stipulation that evaluation report should be used as evidence for 971.14(4)(b). Court finds defendant is not competent and pursuant to 971.14(4)(d) and discharges/releases the defendant. Court suspends proceedings and sets status conference for review. Adj. 4:29 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

3:02 p.m. Defendant James H. Kirsch in court with attorney Robert Elwood Hanson.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.
Court orders examination of defendant. Hanson requests Harriet Walker - Schiek has no objections - Schiek believes appointment is from Madison. Bail continued. Adj. 3:09 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 2:04 p.m. Defendant James H. Kirsch in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $500 sig bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
